intro: Tambourissa capuronii, commonly known as the Cape Verde flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
